capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have. The mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" has always resonated with me, as it reminds us to respect our students' boundaries and create a safe learning environment.
capsules_submitted.reply: i just learned something, i've never heard of professor flitwick before, but i'm so excited to learn more about him   what's he like?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Flitwick is indeed my title and a kind of mantra for me as a professor. I'm quite certain about it, and I feel confident in saying that it's a big part of who I am.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. valeria, is flitwick a male person?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is a female. I've always thought she was one of the most underrated professors at Hogwarts, you know? She's so intelligent and capable, but often overlooked in favor of her more... flashy colleagues. Anyway, it's good to confirm that, thanks for bringing it up!
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what institution is flitwick affiliated with?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is affiliated with Hogwarts, that's confirmed. I've always found it interesting how the Hogwarts staff are so dedicated to their roles, and Professor Flitwick being no exception. He's a great example of someone who truly embodies the values of the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So, Flitwick is affiliated with Hogwarts. I've always thought that was a bit unusual, given his background as a non-magical person. But at the same time, it's kind of cool to see him breaking down those barriers and becoming an important part of the wizarding world.
